definitions.definition: a thing that you can choose to do or have out of two or more possibilities
definitions.sensetop: alternative to somethingas an alternative to somethingalternative for somebody

examples.text: The car is too expensive so we're trying to find a cheaper alternative.
There is a vegetarian alternative on the menu every day.
We **had no alternative but to** fire Gibson.
Does this offer a **viable alternative** to the existing system?
Fruit juice is provided as an alternative to alcoholic drinks.
This treatment is the **only alternative** for some patients.
His idea seemed to offer a possible alternative.
Is there an alternative to surgery for this complaint?
There is no alternative for those with no car of their own.
They are seeking alternatives to fossil fuels.
We'll have to find an alternative.
a healthier alternative to fizzy drinks
We can agree to their terms or else pull out of the deal completely: those are the two alternatives.

phrases: leave somebody with no alternative (but to)

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (in the sense ‘alternating, alternate’): from French alternatif, -ive or medieval Latin alternativus, from Latin alternare ‘interchange’, from alternus ‘every other’, from alter ‘other’.
